properties.name: clustering_columns
properties.description: A comma-delimited list of channels in the FCS that will be used for clustering. Column indices are 1-based, i.e. the first column is 1, second column is 2 etc.

properties.name: limit_events_per_file
properties.description: if the limit is different from 0, a specified amount of events get imported from the beginning of the file. This limits the total size of the dataset, which generally shall not exceed 1M cells.

properties.name: transformation
properties.description: Numerical transformation is essential to ensure that the expression values on each channel are approximately normally distributed. Choice of NONE, ASINH, DOUBLE_ASINH.

properties.name: scaling_factor
properties.description: A factor by which each value gets divided before transformation. 5 is default, but could be set to 3 or lower in order to improve cluster separation on low-intensity channels.

properties.name: noise_threshold
properties.description: A specified noise threshold will be subtracted from every raw value and then all the negative values will be set to zero. This filters out low-lever noise and GREATLY improves clustering in many dimensions.

properties.name: euclidian_length_threshold
properties.description: Setting this limit above 0 excludes events that have low intensity on all channels (unstained cells).

properties.name: rescale
properties.description: Rescaling of clustering channels may help equalizing the extent to which high- and low-expressed markers influence clustering. Choice of NONE, SD, QUANTILE.

properties.name: quantile
properties.description: if quantile rescaling is selected, a quantile on which the rescaling is based should be specified below.

properties.name: rescale_separately
properties.description: rescaling each file separately may help equalizing the variance between runs.
